songs.description: I wanted to listen to something that reminded me of *Over the Garden Wall* but wasn’t a children’s soundtrack. The A’s are lovely and a little haunting which is a combination I enjoy.

Spot Dog came on just as I wandered into a series of empty courtyards in Claremont, California. I listened to the whole album feeling like I was alone on another planet and it’s still one of my favorites.
A good song for driving home at the end of the day because it’s both cozy and cathartic.
A reminder that I am still putting off the perfect moment to watch the Barbie movie. Despite mixed reviews from friends, I am very excited.
Taylor Swift feels like a childhood friend and I just have to support everything she does now.
It’s comforting when one of your favorite artists returns with a familiar sound in a new song.
Akira Kosemura’s soft piano is for journaling, cleaning, sipping coffee, waking up slowly.
